title: How in the WORLD can I reduce LAG!!!!
body: I did everything I could. increased performance downloaded game booster got a gaming PC and have a good router. I even lowered graphics. And it didn't work. I couldn't play and I am worried I will get thrown into low proirity queue. What should I do to reduce these attempting to reconnect things? {{champion:32}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Sackboy,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=prsBmnnk,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2014-12-23T05:58:29.054+0000)
>
> Download more RAM.

yeah u need more 'Dedotated WAM'

WOW %%%%ING WOW RITO, I HAD WRITTEN OUT SO MUCH INFO AND HALF OF ITS GONE BECAUSE YOU CANT EVEN PHP/PERL/w.e language you used to code your webpages. I cant use a Less Than sign, and everything after it disappears.

Internet speed lag is completely irrelevant to famerate drop. Maybe you should take a computer course on this.

If you are unable to play cause your actions take ages to do anything, thats a result of Internet Speed Lag or Ping. 
If you are unable to play cause your game is really choppy and starts and stops alot, thats a result of framerate drop.

To fix Internet speed:
- Try to use an Ethernet Cord to connect from your computer to your router/modem or heaven forbid, directly into your phone line.
- Make sure you arnt running anything else that uses the internet. eg. Facebook, Youtube, other games, any music streaming, updates for programmes etc...
- Make sure you are the only one on the internet at the time that you play. If you have AbottNetâ„¢, or a %%%%ty ISP who runs your internet thru a plastic straw or copper wiring connection, your BANDWIDTH may be too small to have multiple devices running on the internet at the same time.
- If you want to know if your lagging before you start a game, open up your search bar on either Win7 or if your unlucky, Win8, or even unluckier, Win8.1 and type in and search for "cmd". You should get an 'oldskool' looking command propt. In here type >"ping www.google.com" and hit enter. Depending on if you are lagging, this may take some time to print out the results. After it finishes, you should look for 'time=' and look for that number. The lower that number is the better. If the number is consistently low ( ***LESS THAN 200***) you should be fine to play, if its greater than say 500 then your gonna lag. If it says 'request timed out' it means your over 3500 ping.

To make sure you dont lag make sure none of the following are happening.
Torrenting, Downloading, opening webpages, Uploading, Streaming, Watching/Listening to Streams/Audio Streams, getting DDoS'd, ~~being monitored by ASIO, being subjected to Replay Attacks by ASIO~~, Any other person is using a device that is connected to your router/modem be it Computer,Laptop,$3000 Apple Paperweight, Mobile device, Cloud Storage device, Television, etc.

Most useful comment, +1.

Also the quality of wiring in your home and street, and also the distance to the nearest exchange will all affect the quality of your connection.

I used to live on a horrible street that had four hundred year old iron wiring and my only option to get better internet was to literally move to a different street. The worst part was the internet was meant to be awesome there because I was literally 15 metres away from the exchange... only that was physically, not the actual wired distance and sadly that's not how it works.

edit: Oh also I tend to get a lot of leechers on my wifi, random devices hogging all the bandwith that nobody admits to owning. I have to clear everything off and change the wifi name to get a decent connection for LoL every now and then.
just tell your internet provider it's usual free for them to come and inspect your connection and if there is a problem get angry and get free stuff
